conclusion: To determine the amount of heat exchanged, analyze each segment of the cycle and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
The cycle consists of four processes: A to B, B to C, C to D, and D to A.
Process A to B is an isobaric expansion from volume V1 to V2 at pressure P1.
Work done in process A to B is W_AB = P1(V2 - V1).
Heat exchange in process A to B is Q_AB = ΔU_AB + W_AB.
Change in internal energy for A to B is ΔU_AB = nC_v(T_B - T_A).
Process B to C is an isochoric process from pressure P1 to P2.
Work done in process B to C is W_BC = 0.
Heat exchange in process B to C is Q_BC = ΔU_BC = nC_v(T_C - T_B).
Process C to D is an isobaric compression from volume V2 to V1 at pressure P2.
Work done in process C to D is W_CD = P2(V1 - V2).
Heat exchange in process C to D is Q_CD = ΔU_CD + W_CD.
Change in internal energy for C to D is ΔU_CD = nC_v(T_D - T_C).
Process D to A is an isochoric process from pressure P2 to P1.
Work done in process D to A is W_DA = 0.
Heat exchange in process D to A is Q_DA = ΔU_DA = nC_v(T_A - T_D).
Total heat exchanged over the cycle is Q_total = Q_AB + Q_BC + Q_CD + Q_DA.
Total work done over the cycle is W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CD + W_DA.
For a cyclic process, the change in internal energy over one complete cycle is zero.
According to the first law of thermodynamics, Q_total = W_total for the cycle.
The amount of heat exchanged is Q_total = (P1 - P2)(V2 - V1).
